intro: Aster chlorolepis, commonly known as the greenleaf aster, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and features lance-shaped, dark green leaves. Its flowers are usually blue to purple in color and bloom in the late summer to early fall. Aster chlorolepis is often found in moist habitats such as meadows, wetlands, and along stream banks.
